verbose_text: NIK is essential for inhibitor of nuclear factor-kappaB kinase-alpha (IKKa)-induced NF-kappaB2 p100 processing to p52, which, along with RelB, translocate to the nucleus to activate specific gene transcription.
evidence: nuclear factor-kappaB kinase-alpha (IKKa)-induced NF-kappaB2 p100 processing to p52, which, along with RelB, translocate to the nucleus to activate specific gene transcription
